author: Odeinoichus
title: I Choo-Choo Choose You
review:
Set #71005 Ralph Wiggum: Ralph is one of those characters you either love or you hate, he's cute, funny and simple enough on the show. As a Mini-Figure his look is distinct and he's got some interesting pieces. Though not much else to discuss.

As one of the short-legged characters in the Theme he includes short light brown legs and a striking blue torso with a single sided print for his customary shirt. The unique head is actually bald, instead of sculpting hair onto him it's all printed, scraggily looking black hair. And his expression is suitably Ralph. He includes a printed 2x2 tile with the infamous valentine from the classic episode... Er, whatever it was called, I don't recall titles just situations.

Overall I find Ralph to be quite a fun addition to the cast of Springfield in LEGO form, I really hope this doesn't become a one-off Theme like the old Avatar the Last Airbender (who only had two sets made for it) I'd love to see Troy McClure and other famous characters appear in future sets or CMF Series. Ralph is another great Mini-Figure and I rate it accordingly, plus recommend him for fans of the show.

author: sideswinger
title: not that great...
review:
The Simpsons Series was released in 2014, and it was the first series to cost 4 bucks. There isn't much more to say, so let's take a closer look.

Ralph Wiggum's head piece was new for the series and is exclusive to this figure to this day. I love that it's a new sculpt, but it just does not look good. If you've seen this character's physical appearance from the cartoon, this head appears too small, and those soulless white eyes appear super creepy. The hair printed around the rim is appreciated, but I don't know: something about that piece doesn't do it for me.

Ralph's torso has the same issue as the head, where it just doesn't match the character's on-screen appearance. Homer Simpson has the same issue, but for some reason it isn't as big of a blaring issue with him as it is here. Ralph has no back printing.

His legs, while they are caste in a very appealing nougat tone, have no other detail. This 2x2 tile is certainly appreciated, however, though I don't understand it since I haven't watched the show. I'm sure fans of the cartoon will like this, however.

Overall, I appreciate the new head sculpt, but something about Ralph doesn't exactly cut it for me. It just doesn't match the on-screen character as much as I would've liked. I'm still gonna give him a 3 out of 5 since he is a good inclusion.

Thanks for reading!
